contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox university chancellor | name = Karen A. Holbrook | image = | order = | university = 13th President of<br/>[[The Ohio State University]] | term_start = 2002 | term_end = 2007 | birth_date = November 6, 1942 | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | predecessor = [[Edward Harrington Jennings|Edward H. Jennings]] (interim) | successor = [[Joseph A. Alutto]] (interim) | alma_mater = [[University of Wisconsin–Madison]]<br/>[[University of Washington]] | residence = | profession = | religion = | spouse = | children = | website = | footnotes = |}} '''Karen A. Holbrook''' (born November 6, 1942 in [[Des Moines]], [[Iowa]]) was the 13th presiding president of [[Ohio State University|The Ohio State University]]. She took office on October 1, 2002, replacing Interim President [[Edward Harrington Jennings|Edward H. Jennings]]. Holbrook earned her B.S. and M.S. from the [[University of Wisconsin–Madison]], in zoology. After teaching [[biology]] at [[Ripon College (Wisconsin)|Ripon College]], she earned a Ph.D. in biological structure from the [[University of Washington]] School of Medicine in 1972, then pursued further training in [[dermatology]]. She is an alumna of [[Gamma Phi Beta]] sorority. Prior to leading The Ohio State University, Holbrook was a professor of biological structure and medicine at University of Washington School of Medicine, Vice president for Research and [[dean (education)|Dean]] of the Graduate School at the [[University of Florida]], and most recently Senior Vice President for Academic Affairs and [[Provost (education)|Provost]] at the [[University of Georgia]]. At all points in her career Holbrook has continued to research dermatology. In addition to her academic responsibilities, Holbrook serves on several non-profit boards, such as the [[American Association for the Advancement of Science]], [[Association of American Universities]], [[National Association of State Universities and Land-Grant Colleges]], [[Association of American Medical Colleges]], [[ACT (examination)|American College Testing Program]], [[American Council on Education]], [[National Merit Scholarship Corporation]], and [http://www.ncseonline.org National Council for Science and the Environment], among many others. Holbrook resigned from Ohio State on June 30, 2007, ending her five-year career there. [[Joseph A. Alutto]], dean of the [[Max M. Fisher College of Business]] at Ohio State, replaced Holbrook as an interim president until [[Gordon Gee]] took his place as the new president. While on an interview at [[Florida Gulf Coast University]], Holbrook was quoted as saying about Ohio State, "When you win a game, you riot. When you lose a game, you riot. When spring comes, you riot. African-American Heritage Festival weekend, you riot." This statement angered Ohio State students and alumni and Holbrook later stated that her comments were "melodramatic" <ref>[http://www.thelantern.com/2.1346/ex-president-expelled-1.77602 The Lantern - Ex-President Expelled]</ref> Holbrook is currently the Vice President for Research & Innovation at the [[University of South Florida]].<ref>[http://www.research.usf.edu/vpfr/ University of South Florida - Office of the Vice President For Research and Innovation]</ref> She also serves on the [[Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University]] Board of Trustees.<ref>[http://www.erau.edu/administration/trustees/tr-holbrook.html - Embry-Riddle Board of Trustees]</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Further reading== *[http://president.osu.edu/home/past-presidents.html Past Presidents of the Ohio State University] * [http://oncampus.osu.edu/v32n2/thisissue.html onCampus newspaper story on election of Karen Holbrook] * [http://www.osu.edu/news/holbrookletter.pdf Letter of resignation and facts about her years as President] {{s-start}} {{succession box | title=[[List_of_Ohio_State_University_people#Presidents_of_The_Ohio_State_University|Ohio State University President]] | before= [[Edward Harrington Jennings]] (interim)| years=2002-10-01–2007-06-30 | after= [[Joseph A. Alutto]] (interim)}} {{s-end}} {{Ohio State University presidents}} . {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Holbrook, Karen | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = November 6, 1942 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Holbrook, Karen}} [[Category:1942 births]] [[Category:American university and college presidents]] [[Category:University of Washington alumni]] [[Category:University of Wisconsin–Madison alumni]] [[Category:University of Georgia faculty, staff and administration]] [[Category:Presidents of Ohio State University]] [[Category:Ohio State University faculty]] [[Category:University of Florida faculty]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Ripon College (Wisconsin) faculty]]
